turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I don't know if there's any single reason.  But my father was Navy. And he had this old-time recruiting poster in his den.  It showed a girl trying on a sailor's uniform while saying, "Gee, I wish I were a man! I'd join the Navy!"  Was maybe 10 years old when I first saw it, and even then it felt wrong.  Made me mad.  And I don't think a month has gone by that I haven't thought about that poster.  "Gee, I wish I were a man."

turns.speaker: BLONDELL
turns.text: I've been accused of that wish.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: The woman I saw you with...

turns.speaker: BLONDELL
turns.text: Just a friend.  We have friends, too, you know.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: But are there... I mean, how many...

turns.speaker: BLONDELL
turns.text: More than you'd guess.  It's just that we don't hold coffee klatches. If more then three of us get together at any one time, the guys think it's some kind of uprising.

turns.speaker: BLONDELL
turns.text: Administration, Ensign Blondell.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Don't say my name.

turns.speaker: BLONDELL
turns.text: Who's...  Lieuten --

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Or rank.  But can you do me a favor and pull a transfer order?

turns.speaker: BLONDELL
turns.text: Okay, but... You didn't have to do what you did.  Not for me.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: "Wickwire, Thomas Dane."  See what you can find.

turns.speaker: BLONDELL
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Who signed as his "sponsoring officer"?

turns.speaker: BLONDELL
turns.text: Uh... don't see it.  There's no signature.  But hang on -- there's a note to "See Addendum."  Checking...

turns.speaker: BLONDELL
turns.text: Wow...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: What'd you find, Kathy?

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Commander, are you of the habit of letting photographers traipse around your base snappin' their fill? These were supposed to have been discreet test cases --

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Senator, they stand out on the public highway with telephoto lenses --

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: -- and now I got reporters from Toadsquat, Iowa, calling my office and askin' what I know about this "G.I. Jane" thing.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: -- nothing I can do about it unless you're suggesting I infringe on their civil liberties -- which I'd happily do if you'll just trim a little fat off the Constitution.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Are you truly mouthin' off to a senior member of the Senate Arms Committee?  I mean, I'll give you points for style -- just nothin' for smarts.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Well, seein's how this thing is out, you let me handle the r.p.m.  From this point forward, I want all press matters coordinated via my office. I'll be god-damned if I'm gonna watch Hayes pull flowers out of his ass and take credit for this one. Him or the President.  This my shade?  "Midnight Mahogany"? 'Cuz I'm comin' dangerously close to lookin' like Ronald Reagan here.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Your prerogative, Senator.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Awright.  How's our girl doin', anyway?

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Standing right here in my office.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Jordan, dear.  How are they treating you?

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Uh, V.I.P. security arrangements generally take some time, Senator.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: "Security"?  What the hell you talkin' about?  Your base isn't secure?

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Of course, but there's more --

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Then set out the good plates, we'll all have lunch.  My office will follow up with details.  Jumping off, now...

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Yes, of course.  Please, have a seat, lieutenant...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Thank you, sir.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Would you care for a beverage?  Tea?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I'm fine, sir.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: So.  We're still coming to terms with the exact protocol for this -- for integrating the Spec-Recon training.  It may not always be smooth, but we're trying to make it as painless as possible for you.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Thank you, sir.  But I expect a certain amount of pain.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Barber was my next stop, sir. Would've had it regulation sooner, only --

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Don't worry about it.  If it's off your collar and out of your eyes, that's all I'm going to ask.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Really, I have no problem with --

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: I'm not out to change your sex, lieutenant.  You'll have separate beds, separate heads.  If you have specific medical needs, inform the infirmary.  If a classmate or superior acts in an harassing or otherwise unbecoming manner, please inform me immediately so I can deal with it immediately.  Questions?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: None at this time, sir.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Then that's all I have to say. Dismissed.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Sir, I just want you to know... I'm not here to make a statement.  I don't want to make men look foolish. All I care about is completing the training and getting operational experience -- just like everyone else, I suspect.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: If you were like everyone else, lieutenant, I suspect we wouldn't be making statements about not making statements, would we?  Take your leave.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Pardon the hour, sir.  But you told me to come to you immediately if I felt I was being mistreated in any way.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Didn't take long.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: All right, lieutenant, give me a name and specifics, I'll have the X.O. file an action first thing in the morning.  A name?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: It's you, sir.  And it started the day I came here.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Oh, really.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: It's this double-standard, the separate quarters, the deferential treatment.  It's how you pulled out my chair and nearly served high tea the first time we met.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Because I was civil, now you're complaining.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I can't afford civility, sir.  How am I supposed to fit in with these guys when you've got me set up as an outsider?  Even if I make it under these rules, I still lose, because there'll always be a flag in my file -- "Yeah, she made it, but..."  I mean, really -- why didn't you just issue me a goddamn petticoat to wear around the base?

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Did you just have a brain-fart?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Pardon?

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Did you just barge in here and curse at your base commander?  If so, I regard that as a bonafide brain- fart, and I resent it when people fart inside my home.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I think you've resented me from the start, sir.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: What I resent, lieutenant, is some politician using my base as a test tube for her grand social experiment.  What I resent is the sensitivity training that is now mandatory for my men... the day-care center I have to build where an officer's lounge used to be... and the OB/GYN I have to keep on staff just so someone can keep track of your personal pap smears.  But most of all, lieutenant, I resent your perfume, however subtle it may be, competing with the aroma of my fine three-dollar-and-fifty- nine cent cigar, which I will happily put out this very instant if the phallic nature of it happens to offend your goddamn fragile sensibilities.  DOES IT?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: No, sir, WHAT?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: The shape doesn't bother me.  It's just that goddamn rotten stench.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Well.  'Least now we're talking the same language.  So one standard.  Is that what you're after?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Same rules for everyone, sir.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Straight up?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Across the board, sir.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: And if you just happen to wash out, I won't have to contend with you bitchin' to some hairy-chested female Senator?  And please note I did not identify any one in particular.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Wouldn't dream of it, sir.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Then good night.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: So I'll get a fair shot?

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: You'll get everything you want, O'Neil.  Let's see if you want what you're gonna get.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: See me, sir?

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: You makin' friends with the press, lieutenant?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Sir, I want you to know that I had nothing to do with any of this.  Not this article, not --

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: "We'll all have lunch."  Good idea. Oh, and let's be sure to invite this sociologist, too -- just in case we want to have a FUCKING BRIDGE GAME AFTERWARDS!

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Permission to leave, sir?

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Permission to evaporate, O'Neil.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: I don't know of any delicate way to say this, lieutenant, so I won't try.  Claims have been made that you have engaged in fraternization -- of the same-sex variety.  Specifically, that you were...  "... seen leaving the apartment of another female officer at such a time and in such a manner as to suggest conduct unbecoming."

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Sir, if someone is suggesting that I'm a lesbian, they're wrong.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I'm saying, we're just friends.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: I find this as distasteful as you, lieutenant.  But if it's on my desk, it's on my shoulders.  There's going to be an inquiry -- it will not be quick and it will definitely not be pretty.  You should prepare yourself.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Sir, please... if there's any way to do this without dragging everyone through the mud...

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: I don't see how, O'Neil.  Dismissed.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Sir.  If tomorrow... I was not under your command... would the inquiry still go forward?

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: I'm not sure what --

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Would you have the discretion to end it right then and there?

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Well, if you had to go over my head, lieutenant, that's the way to do it.  Christ, nothin' like a 0-200 call from the Commander and Chief to get the bowels movin'.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Sir?  What did he say?

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Basically -- he asked me if I could unring a bell.

turns.speaker: CORTEZ
turns.text: Aw, what is this...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Sir...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Ah, c'mon...

turns.speaker: CORTEZ
turns.text: Motherachrist...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Fine by me, sir!

turns.speaker: CORTEZ
turns.text: No problem, sir!

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Newberry, get a photo.  South?

turns.speaker: CORTEZ
turns.text: Entering my scan now...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: West?

turns.speaker: MCCOOL
turns.text: Shit.  Think we're had.

turns.speaker: CORTEZ
turns.text: Smoke her.

turns.speaker: MCCOOL
turns.text: I ain't gonna shoot her.

turns.speaker: CORTEZ
turns.text: Only blanks.  Lemme do it.

turns.speaker: MCCOOL
turns.text: Hey.  Ain't your call, man.

turns.speaker: CORTEZ
turns.text: Banditos on the east perimeter!  150 yards!  Shit, she was part of it!

turns.speaker: MCCOOL
turns.text: Fuck me.

turns.speaker: CORTEZ
turns.text: What, we're gonna pry 'em out with paddles?

turns.speaker: MCCOOL
turns.text: O'Neil.  Our air's gonna crap out as soon as we get down there.  You know that, don't you?

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN'S AIDE
turns.text: White House boys want a private meeting.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: I'll act surprised.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Think I overplayed it?

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN'S AIDE
turns.text: Congress and the Pentagon share a lot of plumbing.  They'll never know whose leak it is.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN'S AIDE
turns.text: Did you hear?

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: She made it through S.E.R.E. training.  Got a call this morning from --

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN'S AIDE
turns.text: Not that.  The White House just announced that it was sponsoring legislation that would, in one stroke, void all remaining elements of the 1948 Combat Exclusion Laws.

turns.speaker: HAYES
turns.text: ... last few years have brought many advances in the interests of women in naval service, particularly in the land-based maritime specialties. What's more, the Navy has instituted special sensitivity courses with an eye on --

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa.  "Land-based maritime specialties." Gimme a second here to de-euphemize that...

turns.speaker: HAYES
turns.text: Hardly the case, Senator.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Well, I'm just an old dame without much time left, so you'll pardon me if I jump right in here before they discontinue my blood-type.  I am deeply concerned over the Navy's seemingly incontrovertible attitude toward women in the military.  Case in point...

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: "The Lark Report."

turns.speaker: HAYES
turns.text: Madam Senator... this is an internal document of the U.S. Navy.  I must seriously question whether --

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: The Navy's conclusion regarding the crash of an F-14 aboard an aircraft carrier.  Female aviator, it just so happens.  You're familiar with this report and its conclusion, am I right?

turns.speaker: HAYES
turns.text: I was one member of the investigating commission.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Yes, I see your signature right here -- twice the size of everyone else's.  And your conclusion was "pilot error," hmm?

turns.speaker: HAYES
turns.text: I'm really not prepared for any kind of in-depth review of --

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: I'd like to think our next Secretary of the Navy would be prepared for anything, Mr. Hayes.

turns.speaker: HAYES
turns.text: The commission concluded that the aviator in question failed to execute a proper approach to the carrier.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: That aside for the moment, I'm struck by the tenor, the ill-spirit of your report... the degrading remarks by other aviators... innuendo about her performance in unrelated situations... even a reference to her sexual activity the weekend prior.  In my seven years on this committee, I've never seen a downed aviator treated like this.  Never.  I'm deeply disturbed by this report, Mr. Hayes.  Not just what it bodes for women in the military -- but for your own confirmation as well.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: So everyone I talk to says you're top drawer with silk stockings inside.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Thank you, ma'am.  Um, may I ask what this is regarding?

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: High-school pentathlete... ROTC scholarship, graduated with honors... top marks in Basic Training... and, as it just so happens, a constituent of my home state of Virginia.  Oh, the things I'll do for one extra vote.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: "Coronado."

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: California.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I know that, sir.  Ma'am.  It's just that... Beggin' your pardon, Senator, but... do you understand that this involves combat training?

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: This is just a test case, O'Neil. But if it works out -- if you work out -- it could well change the Navy's official policy on women in combat.  Or, actually, its official non-policy.  Now who's your immediate superior there?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Captain Dwyer.  Technically.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: My office will fill him in and help expedite.  Look forward to meeting you at the proper time.  Jumping off now...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Uh, question, ma'am.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Yes, dear.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Would I be the only one?  The only woman?

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: There'll be more to follow -- but yes, dear, right now you're the pick of a very large litter.  And your success would mean a lot.  Jumping, now...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Can't complain, ma'am.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Hmmm.  Maybe I'll ask when I see you in person.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Uh, ma'am.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Gonna be visiting that all-woman's America's cup team in a few weeks -- If I were a gambler, I'd say Dennis O'Conner's days are numbered.  But they're in San Diego, so I thought I'd take a quick promenade of the base.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Jordan.  I always hoped we'd get together -- though just now I'm gearing up for a child-care vote that --

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Lieutenant Thomas Wickwire.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: You know him.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Sounds familiar.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: It should.  You nominated him for Spec-Recon just three days after you nominated me.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Jordan.  Might we do this over lunch tomorrow?  I do very much want to talk, but now is scarcely --

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Did you set me up?  Did you set me up just to see me fail?

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Absolutely not.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Wickwire was there to help.  To be my eyes on the inside, to make sure you were getting a fair shot.  At least that was the intent.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: What changed?

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Should probably ask him that.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: If I have to ask again, Senator, I'll be asking in front of cameras.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: So?  Isn't the President jumping on your bandwagon?

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: What he did was light the bandwagon on fire.  Because he knows what I know -- that American families are not prepared to put their daughters in harm's way.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: You don't know that.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: In face, I do:  Roper, Harris, Gallop -- they all come back the same.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: What are you saying?  That a women's life is more valuable than a man's? That a women's death hurts a family more?

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: I'm saying it's not going to happen. Not when the President is set to turn this into a third-rail issue should I choose to ever campaign against him.  He will fry me six ways to Sunday for sending daughters and young mothers off to war -- and, quite possibly, for bringing them back in body bags.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: You were never going to let women serve in combat.  You always had a safety net.  Or thought you did.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Jordan.  I don't expect you to fully understand this -- but sometimes there's more to be gained from the fight than the victory.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: So the rhetoric gets you headlines. But the reality gets you in trouble.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: The reality is this:  We send far too many men off to war.  I don't need to compound the problem with women.  Can you honestly tell me you wanted that life?  Squat-pissing in some third-world jungle with --

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I wanted the choice.  The chance to prove myself, my skills, my work, me.  That's how it should've been.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: I once promised you a fast ticket, Jordan, and I always meant to make good on that.  Come work for me.  I can always use a hard-charger on my team.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: You promise Wickwire a fast ticket, too?

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: I've had no direct communication with him since this whole thing began.  And that's quite verifiable.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I'm sure it is.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: You'll think about my offer?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: You know, I wonder what the SecNav would think about it.  If I spoke with him.

turns.speaker: DEHAVEN
turns.text: Well, I spoke with Mr. Hayes this morning myself -- and told him the deal was off.  No more test cases. He was only too happy to oblige.  Don't play politics with me, little darlin'.  You'd be up way past your bedtime.

turns.speaker: HAYES
turns.text: So she picks the women, we pick the programs.  Seals?

turns.speaker: FLAG OFFICER #1
turns.text: I'd go Special Reconnaissance. Every bit as tough -- and we have a 60 percent drop-out rate among the men.

turns.speaker: HAYES
turns.text: Then I suggest we start there.

turns.speaker: FLAG OFFICER #1
turns.text: Doesn't matter who she picks.  No woman is going to last one week in a commando training course.  And I don't care who it is.

turns.speaker: HAYES
turns.text: What the hell is the President trying to do?  Steal DeHaven's thunder?

turns.speaker: FLAG OFFICER #1
turns.text: I think it's more important, sir, to decide what we're going to do -- since it's apparent this issue is not going away quietly.

turns.speaker: HAYES
turns.text: "G.I. Jane."  And which one of you told me she wouldn't last a week? Huh?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Montgomery, why do they call you "Flea"?

turns.speaker: FLEA
turns.text: It's really "F. Lee Montgomery" -- but that gets whittled down to just "Flea."  For short, ma'am.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: So it really has nothing to do with actual brain size?

turns.speaker: FLEA
turns.text: No, ma'am.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Well, Flea, I appreciate the respect you just showed me.  But I don't need it and don't want it -- not that kind of respect, anyway.  It's just gonna hurt us both, okay?

turns.speaker: FLEA
turns.text: I'll work on it, ma'am.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Do that.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Hey.  You okay, Flea?

turns.speaker: FLEA
turns.text: 'Snot me.  It's him.

turns.speaker: FLEA
turns.text: Really don't wanna be captured, el- tee.  Heard some bad things.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Fuck.  Basher-Basher, this is Ground Crew Six requesting emergency extraction. Stand by for a PRC fix...

turns.speaker: FLEA
turns.text: Close as I can get, el-tee!

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Flea, 'Cool, Cortez, Newman -- take your minis, hit the water.  Go, GO!

turns.speaker: FLEA
turns.text: Six o'clock!  Marking, marking!

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Spotted you, Chief.  Pri One is to slip you some air, so we're coming down with a tank -- just something until the A-team shows.  Over.

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR JOHNS
turns.text: Don't have to use it, O'Neil, but it's gotta go out.  Five... four... three...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I can make this wall without --

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR JOHNS
turns.text: ... two... one... MARK!

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Just do it, okay?

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR JOHNS
turns.text: If you can't feel the other guy's pecker, you ain't in tight enough! I want nuts to butts!

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Come on, Montgomery...

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR JOHNS
turns.text: Flea!  O'Neil!  Why is there a break in that line?

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR JOHNS
turns.text: O'Neil?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR JOHNS
turns.text: You're wanted at the C.O.'s.

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR PYRO
turns.text: Time.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Check your watch, Pyro.  Seems fast.

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR PYRO
turns.text: Miller.  Thought the guy was made of depleted uranium.  Really didn't expect to lose him.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Every class has its surprises, Pyro. This one'll be no different.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Boat Five -- Wickwire, Cozad, Vinyl, Intagliata, Ayers, and Wise. Lieutenant Wickwire is your senior officer.  Follow his orders to your death.

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR PYRO
turns.text: Get it up!

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: You don't think she'd be raped if she were captured?  You don't think the threat of rape would be used to leverage the men?

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR PYRO
turns.text: You broke a dozen training rules back there -- before I lost count.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: I've had it.  Just because they pay me like a baby-sitter doesn't mean I'm gonna be one.

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR PYRO
turns.text: She's a trainee, just like the others.  Why are you coming down so hard?

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: She's an officer.  There's a higher standard.

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR PYRO
turns.text: She's a women, and that's why you're ridin' her bareback.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Of course it is.  And I'm gonna stay on her until everyone realizes this is not some bullshit equal-rights thing, that real lives are gonna be lost.  Maybe mine, maybe yours.

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR PYRO
turns.text: I oughtta report you.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: I think you probably would -- if you didn't know I was right.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Thank you, sir.  But I like these just fine.

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR PYRO
turns.text: Not doin' them very fine, O'Neil.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I'll try anyway, sir.

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR PYRO
turns.text: You'll try what we tell you to try, O'Neil.  Go regulation.

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR PYRO
turns.text: Automatic five-second deduction, which slips you under the wire. It's called "gender-norming," O'Neil -- standard procedure for all females in physical training courses.  Where you been the last few years?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: What "all females"?  If I'm the only --

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: The Navy Cross...

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR PYRO
turns.text: I believe he earned it for saving a man's life in Saudi Arabia.  He wanted you to have it.  He was very clear on that point.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I was looking for him earlier, but...

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR PYRO
turns.text: The Chief was granted early retirement as of 17-hundred yesterday.  By 18-hundred he was gone.  Out of the Navy.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Just a coincidence?

turns.speaker: INSTRUCTOR PYRO
turns.text: Maybe it's not my place to speculate on his private thoughts.  But I think the Chief knew that his way -- his world -- had come and gone.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Lieutenant O'Neil.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Gotta situation here.  Where are you?  Stuck in traffic?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Not due in for 22 minutes, sir. Watcha got?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Do we know it's him using the beacon?  Not a decoy?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Signals received only sparingly, in such a pattern that leads us to conclude it is a downed aviator trying to conserve his batteries.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Chances of recovery?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: You're the analyst for East China, O'Neil.  Analyze.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: North Korean beaches are the best protected, most heavily monitored in the world.  The civilian population is so propagandized that it acts as an Early Warning system.  Extraction team has to be small and silent -- I'd go with Seals over Delta Force. Problem is, don't want to hold a conventional sub off-shore for target practice.  Where's The Polk?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Halfway 'round the world.  So that's the problem -- we can get the team in, just not out.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Unless you Whiskey Run.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Blank faces here, O'Neil.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Quick-hit technique used by Capone. Rigged a getaway car with running boards and handles.  All his guys had to do was jump on and take a ride.  Check the files -- DPRK-57 -- I doped it out as a contingency plan:  Seal Team infiltrates, picks up the package, links up with recovery sub.  But don't waste time opening and closing hatches.  They just grab the periscope and hang on for neutral waters.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: You expect the extraction team to ride the sub bare-back?  Is that correct, O'Neil?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Only four minutes to neutral waters, sir.  Why not?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: That was good headwork, lieutenant.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Thank you, sir.  We hear back from the Pentagon?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Probably hear back from CNN first.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Hate this part.  Just sweating it out on the sidelines.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Intel has its own glory, lieutenant -- no matter how subtle.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: By the way, I'll need that option paper by 11-hundred today so I can review it with Admiral Hanover.  And do we have any of that breakfast tea around here?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Is this my glory, sir?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: So why're you even considering it? Are you?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Just like you would be.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Spec-Recon.  Those guys are world- class warriors.  And they will not want you there, Jordan.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I take it you don't either.  Feet.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Well, you're doin' shit-hot at Intel.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Royce.  We're the same age, we started the same time -- and now you're sitting in the upperdecks while I'm still down in the bullpen. What does that tell you about the Navy?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: She's haze grey and underway...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: You need operational duty to really advance... you need combat training to go operational... yet combat training is off-limits to people with tits.  I'm topped out at Intel. Forget the glass ceiling -- I'm beating my head on a big brass ceiling.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: So dump on me.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: This has nothing to do with you.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Well, guess I don't even need to be here...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Get your dick back here.  It has everything to do with you.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: You're such a ball-breaker sometimes.  Especially at night.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Sorry.  But after our days...  So if I try this thing... if I ship out to Coronado... what happens here?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: I'll try to keep the door open.  If you wash out, I make it so that --

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Wai', wait.  What happens if it works?  Four months of training, three years of operational duty. What then?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: I don't feel like doing an option paper on the rest of my life, Jordan.  Maybe we should just let it happen.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Which is guy-speak for...

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Sounded lame as soon as it came out of my mouth.  But I'm trying to be honest, okay?  Three years is a long time.  Don't ask me to predict how I'll feel then, Jordan, because I don't know.  And either do you.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: You know, right up until you said that -- I thought I did know.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Jordan...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Thank you, Royce.  It was shaping up like such a tough call -- and then you go and make it so goddamn easy. Really, thank you so much.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: I've been trying you for five days. Don't they give you messages?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: It's hard to find time to sleep, Royce.  Much less keep up with my phone life.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: How hard they making it on you?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: That bad?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I feel like there's men here, there's women here -- then there's men.  But hey, what'd I expect?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Well, not this.  I was doing the Pentagon scene few nights ago.  Got some fresh stuff -- about you.  You may be in a hostile camp.  I think someone may be taking steps to ensure that you crash and burn.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Me?  Why me?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Don't you know?  How they're talking about you?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I saw an article...

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: I can't walk two blocks in Washington without hearing about "G.I. Jane."  You're all over the place, and whether you wanted it or not, the feminists are sizing you up for that poster.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: So why are you telling me this?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Big symbols make big targets, Jordan.  I think someone's gunning for you.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: You know, Royce, I got enough heat on me without you turning up the jets, too.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: I'm only trying to warn you in case --

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Well, let me warm you:  I'm going though with this.  The more everybody fucks with me, fucks with my head, the more it just makes me want to finish.  So don't expect me back crying in your arms any time soon, okay?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: That's not what I want, Jordan.  I mean... it is and it isn't...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Still can't make up your mind, huh? Gotta go, Royce.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Jordan.  You watch your ass.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Sure.  I'll join the crowd.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: All I wanted was an honest chance. And If I couldn't get it, I couldn't stay.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: And this class officer... "Wickwire."  You think he was just trying to get even?  Striking back for...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Maybe.  Though it didn't seem like he was getting any satisfaction out of it.  Almost like...  Did I say he was class officer?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Almost like someone put him up to it.  Okay, who?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: No shortage of suspects.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: The Chief?  Or maybe even Turrentine?  Your C.O.?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: C'mon, Jordan.  Do the headwork with me.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: It's done with, Royce.  Let it go.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Someone screwed you over like this, left unanswered charges hanging over your head, and you're not gonna fight back?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I'm tired of fighting back.  I just wanted to come home and be safe and have you here and the river there and just forget the rest of the world, okay?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Well, before you crawl off to die, Jordan, give me five minutes of good headwork.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: "John James Urgayle."  The Chief.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: What about him.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Instructors typically pull three year assignments.  This guy's in and out in one year -- your year.  That sound right?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Sounds like an amazing coincidence.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Or like maybe he was baby sitting a problem child for the Navy.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I don't know, I don't care.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Well, pardon me if I do.  Now who else?  Who could've leveraged a class officer like that?  C'mon, Jordan, keep your head in the game.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: "In Washington..."

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Wickwire said he was dry-docked in Washington between stints at Coronado...

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: "Wickwire, Thomas Dane"... Second run at Coronado... and correct, they had him stashed in the "Appropriation Liaison Office," whatever that is.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: You don't crap out of Spec-Recon and get another shot without dispensation from someone up in flag country.  He's got a Sea Daddy somewhere.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: I'd sure like to know who.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Yeah.  Me too.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: So here we are again.  Staring three years of operational duty in the face.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Look.  It's not like you'd be completely out of reach.  And maybe we could call in a few favors, get you stationed at Norfolk instead of Coronado.  There are ways of dealing with these things -- I mean, if people are so inclined.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Which is guy-speak for...

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: "Yes, Jordan -- I'll wait for you no matter how long."

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: They're more afraid of you.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Well, now I feel so much better.

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: It was made clear before you came -- harassment equals career suicide. Can't say anything good, so they don't say much at all.  To your face, anyway.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Whose orders were those?

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: It was made clear.  Anyway, stay ballsy.  First week's hell, then it levels out.  Until S.E.R.E. training, anyway.  That's hell-and-a-half.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: And how do you know that?

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: Made it to Week 10 last time.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I didn't know they let you try again.  Especially at your age.

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: You're kind of a surprise yourself.

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: Hey.  Way to gut it out.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Thanks, Wick.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: You know, I had an apartment about this size once.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Wick.  They got your crew, too?

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: Intagliata was out chasing breakfast.  They found his tracks. Well, shit.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: You really came back for more?  Of this?

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: When I was sittin' behind a desk in Washington, it made sense, somehow. Blame it on my big brother.  He was Spec-Recon.  And the stories he used to tell...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: If you got a good one, Wick...

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: One time he was doing a rekkie of the Libyan coastline.  This is, like, right before we bombed Khadaffi into the past tense.  So his crew does a nighttime infil, maps all the big artillery placements and stuff, then turns around to get the hell gone.  But between them and the water are five Libyan guards, all armed to the nuts.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: They had to kill 'em?

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: Nah, they were dead-ass asleep.  But on every guard's chest,they left one Marlboro cigarette.  Just a little calling card to say they'd been there -- and could come back any time they wanted.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: That's a good story.

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: So the shit you gotta go through? To get from here to there?  Brother said it was worth it.  Worth the training... worth the divorce... worth anything.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: He was married?

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: At first.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: You got anybody, Wick?

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: Not me.  You?

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: O'Neil?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: How'd you make it last time, Wick? How'd you get through this part?

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: Last time I didn't.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Let's keep talkin', Wick.  Just keep talkin' to me...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Sorry, didn't mean to --

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: That's okay.  Just an ex-girlfriend. And know I remember why.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: First big night of liberty and no date?  You're pathetic, Wickwire.

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: Maybe I'll just head over to McP's with the others, have a drink or four.  Don't wanna come, do you?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I can't go out.  Not like this.

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: I think you look beautiful.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Thanks for lying.  But you're the class officer, Wick, and it'd just be weird if we hook up.  Besides...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Do you, uh, know...

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: Sure, sure.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: We're going over to her place to make salad and pasta.  Just, you know, nothing special.

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: Okay.  Well... thought I'd ask.

turns.speaker: WICKWIRE
turns.text: I'm sorry, O'Neil.  But as class officer, it's my obligation to report all violations.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: This is insane.  You've got no proof.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: What're you guys doing?  Huh?

turns.speaker: MCCOOL
turns.text: Just askin'

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: What, you gonna give it all up for a maple twist?  How dumb you gotta be? That's exactly what they --

turns.speaker: MCCOOL
turns.text: She part of the training?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: If not, firing will only give away our position to hostiles in the area.  Now how smart is that?

turns.speaker: MCCOOL
turns.text: Mighta been civilian.

turns.speaker: MCCOOL
turns.text: 32 feet, six inches!

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I'm lookin', I'm lookin'!

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: 'Cool?

turns.speaker: MCCOOL
turns.text: Smoke it!

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: So we got two full mini-tanks, three minutes each.  'Cool?  How much air in yours?

turns.speaker: MCCOOL
turns.text: Maybe half.  Not even.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Grab an oar, find a way to weight it down, we're gonna need it.  Cortez, help him.  Flea?  You take one of the two full minis -- and just follow my lead.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Say again, sir?

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: You heard me.  Move on.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Chief, sir, I don't understand why --

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Educate her, Pyro.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Permission to get dressed, sir?

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: It seems the men couldn't get used to the sight of women blown open and their viscera hanging from tree limbs.  Israeli men would linger over wounded females -- often to the detriment of the mission, often endangering their own lives.  They don't use women anymore.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Sir, someone mentioned you received the Navy Cross.  May I ask what you got it for?

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: For pulling a 210-pound man out of a burning barrack in Saudi Arabia.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I see.  So when a man tries to rescue another man, he's a hero. But when he tries to rescue a woman, he's gone soft.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Could you have pulled that 210-pound man clear, lieutenant?

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Females in combat situations impact unit cohesion.  Men fight better without women around.  And that is an historical fact.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: It also seems like a problem with the men's attitude, sir.  So maybe you should be sniffing around their shower room instead.
